Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(2) Summary

Jeff Bezos' famous API mandate was issued in 2002. It still is getting mentioned when it comes to API strategy and how to make sure that organizations get the most out of using APIs. We take a look at the mandate's five rules and explain what they mean and what their results are. We also look at what we can still learn from those rules today, and why it is important to understand how they work together. The essence of the rules is that they tell us what is important when it comes to building a platform: They are a platform vision put into an API strategy that makes sure that you are using APIs in the right way to make the platform vision a reality. After this presentation you know why platforms matter, how APIs play an essential role in any platform strategy, and how Bezos' five rules help you to build a platform that works.

(7) Jeff Bezos' API Mandate: What the Five Rules mean and do [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hIP7mHRog4o]



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(8) #1: All Data/Capabilities must have APIs



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(9) APIs are the Platform

  • Platforms must make it easy to build digital value chains
  • APIs are the connective fabric of digital transformation
  • Anything without an API is not contributing to the platform


Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(10) #2: Team Communications uses APIs



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(11) Teams must use the Platform

  • Platform practice makes perfect
  • Teams create platform products
  • Teams consume platform products
  • The platform is a team effort with everybody participating


Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(12) #3: No Shortcuts



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(13) Strategy Matters

  • We build and collaborate on the platform
  • Shortcuts undermine the platform
  • Short-term gains cannot compromise long-term goals


Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(14) #4: Technology is Secondary



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(15) Value > Delivery

  • What matters most is to expose value on the platform
  • How it is exposed matters as well, but less so


Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(16) #5: APIs must be Externalizable



Jeff Bezos' API Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(17) Every API is a Product

  • Any API may get exposed outside the organization
  • Private/Partner/Public designations for APIs may change
  • Prevent disruptions of the platform as much as possible


API Platforms

Outline (API Platforms)

  2. Jeff Bezos' API Mandate [11]

API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(19) What is a Platform?

  • Platform businesses focus on building Multi-Sided Platforms (MSPs)
  • Tech platforms help with effectiveness and changeability
  • API platforms are an essential ingredient of digital transformation


API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(20) Why? The Network Effects Needs a Network

  • It's ineffective to try a little bit of a platform model
  • ROI grows more than linear because options grow more than linear


API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(21) What? The Platform is a Team Effort

  • Everybody consumes from and contributes to the platform
  • Nobody assumes that their product cannot be reused or improved


API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(22) How? Loose Coupling Needs Design and Discipline

  • API products are essential for the platform to be useful
  • API product thinking is important for the platform to be useful
  • Everybody thinks about building API products for others


Conclusions

Outline (Conclusions)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. Jeff Bezos' API Mandate [11]
  3. API Platforms [4]

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today

(24) The Power of Strategy

  • Growing and evolving your business needs a solid platform
  • APIs work best when the network effect is taking off
  • ROI is best when the platform is reaching critical mass quickly


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Jeff Bezos' API Mandate and what we can (still) learn from it today
